official-title.#text: To establish a pilot program for the expedited disposal of Federal real property.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

committee-name.#tail: for a period ending not later than January 2, 2015, for consideration of such provisions of the bill as fall within the jurisdiction of that committee pursuant to clause 1(r) of rule X

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Excess Federal Building and Property Disposal Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Excess Federal Building and Property Disposal Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Federal real property disposal pilot program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following new subchapter:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chapter 5 of subtitle I of title 40, United States Code

header.#text: Federal real property disposal pilot program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this subchapter referred to as the
(in this subchapter referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the Director, shall determine which 15 Federal Government real properties that are excess or surplus and have the highest fair market value and the greatest potential to sell and shall dispose of such properties in accordance with this subchapter and through an expedited disposal of real property.

term.#tail: ), shall conduct a pilot program to be known as the

term.#text: Federal Real Property Disposal Pilot Program

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Excess Federal Building and Property Disposal Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Excess Federal Building and Property Disposal Act of 2013

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the Director, shall dispose of real property under the Federal Real Property Disposal Pilot Program through a public auction.

text.#text: During the five-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the Director, shall designate an additional property, in accordance with subsection (a), to be disposed of under the Federal Real Property Disposal Pilot Program.

text.#text: Not later than 15 days after a property is disposed of under subsection (b), the

header.#text: Adding properties to the pilot program

text.#text: The
A parcel of real property, building, or other structure located on such real property that is to be closed or realigned under the

any property within the limits of any Indian reservation to which the United States owns title; and

any property title which is held in trust by the United States for the benefit of any Indian tribe or individual or held by an Indian tribe or individual subject to restriction by the United States against alienation.
Properties operated and maintained by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tennessee Valley Authority pursuant to the Tennessee Valley Authority Act of 1933

Properties used in connection with river, harbor, flood control, reclamation, or power projects.

for transfer to a State, a political subdivision or instrumentality of a State, or a municipality for use as a public park or recreation area under

Properties used, as of the date of the enactment of this subchapter, in connection with Federal programs for recreational and conservation purposes, including research for such programs.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and make publicly available a study of the effectiveness of the Federal Real Property Pilot Program.

text.#text: Not later than 24 months after the date of the enactment of this subchapter, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Excess Federal Building and Property Disposal Act of 2013

short-title.#text: Excess Federal Building and Property Disposal Act of 2013

text.#text: The Federal Real Property Disposal Pilot Program shall terminate on the date that is five years after the date of the enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall then select properties for disposal under the pilot program and notify the recommending executive agency accordingly.

text.#text: The head of each executive agency shall recommend properties to the Director for disposal under the Federal Real Property Pilot Program. The Director, in consultation with the

term.#tail: is the sale of real property for cash that is conducted pursuant to the requirements of

text.#text: For purposes of this subchapter, an

header.#text: Expedited disposal of real property defined

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in consultation with the Director. Costs associated with disposal may not exceed the fair market value of the property unless the Director approves incurring such costs.

text.#text: Real property sold under the Federal Real Property Pilot Program may not be sold at less than the fair market value as determined by the

Real property shall be sold under the Federal Real Property Pilot Program only if the property will generate monetary proceeds to the Federal Government, as provided in subsection (b). A disposal of real property under the Federal Real Property Pilot Program may not include any exchange, trade, transfer, acquisition of like-kind property, or other non-cash transaction as part of the disposal.

Nothing in this subchapter shall be construed as terminating or in any way limiting authorities that are otherwise available to agencies under other provisions of law to dispose of Federal real property, except as provided in subsection (e).
Any expedited disposal of a real property conducted under this subchapter shall not be subject to—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 501 of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act

text.#text: any other provision of law authorizing the no-cost conveyance of real property owned by the Federal Government; or
any congressional notification requirement other than that in

The proceeds from an expedited disposal of real property under this subchapter shall be deposited into the General Fund of the Treasury. Two percent of such proceeds is authorized to be appropriated until expended to fund the grant program under

header.#text: Special rules for deposit and use of proceeds from expedited disposals

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for use under this section, the
shall make grants to eligible private nonprofit organizations under subsection (b) to purchase property suitable for use to assist the homeless as provided in subsection (c).
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

text.#text: To the extent amounts are made available pursuant to
To be eligible to receive a grant under subsection (a), a private nonprofit organization shall be a representative of the homeless, as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 501(i)(4) of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act

header.#text: Use of properties for housing or shelter for the homeless

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ), or temporary shelter, for persons who are homeless.

text.#text: A nonprofit organization that receives a grant under subsection (a) shall use the amounts received under such grant only to acquire or rehabilitate real property for use to provide permanent housing (as such term is defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ), transitional housing (as such term is defined in such

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 401 of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not make a grant under subsection (a) to a private nonprofit organization unless the organization provides the Secretary with such assurances as the Secretary determines necessary to ensure that any property acquired or rehabilitated using the amounts received under such grant is used only as provided in paragraph (1) of this subsection for a period of not fewer than 15 years.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall give preference for such grants to private nonprofit organizations that operate within areas in which Federal real property is being sold under the Federal Real Property Disposal Pilot Program under this subchapter.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

header.#text: Duties of the General Services Administration and executive agencies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended to read as follows:

header.#text: Duties of the General Services Administration and executive agencies
Duties of the General Services Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue guidance for the development and implementation of executive agency real property plans. Such guidance shall include recommendations on—

text.#text: Not later than 6 months after the date of the enactment of this section, and when necessary thereafter, the
how to identify excess properties;
how to evaluate the costs and benefits associated with disposing of real property;
how to prioritize disposal decisions based on agency missions and anticipated future need for holdings; and
how best to dispose of those properties identified as excess to meet the needs of the agency.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall assist executive agencies in the identification and disposal of excess real property.

text.#text: The
Each executive agency shall—
maintain adequate inventory controls and accountability systems for property under its control;
continuously survey property under its control to identify excess property;
promptly report excess property to the
perform the care and handling of excess property; and
transfer or dispose of excess property as promptly as possible in accordance with authority delegated and regulations prescribed by the

header.#text: Specific requirements with respect to real property

text.#text: With respect to real property, each executive agency shall—
develop and implement a real property plan in order to identify properties to declare as excess using the guidance issued under subsection (a)(1);
identify and categorize all real property owned, leased, or otherwise managed by the agency;
establish adequate goals and incentives to reduce excess real property in such agency’s inventory; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in order to identify and prepare real property to be reported as excess.

text.#text: when appropriate, use the authorities in
Each executive agency, as far as practicable, shall—
reassign property to another activity within the agency when the property is no longer required for the purposes of the appropriation used to make the purchase;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and

text.#text: transfer excess property under its control to other Federal agencies and to organizations specified in
obtain excess properties from other Federal agencies to meet mission needs before acquiring non-Federal property.

The authority under clause (i) to obligate funds to prepare properties to be reported excess does not include the authority to convey such properties by use, sale, lease, exchange, or otherwise, including through leaseback arrangements or service agreements.
Nothing in this subparagraph is intended to affect subparagraph (D).

header.#text: Proceeds from transfer or sale of real property

text.#text: Net proceeds described in subsection (d) shall be deposited into the appropriate real property account of the agency that had custody and accountability for the real property at the time the real property is determined to be excess.

text.#text: The net proceeds described in this subsection are proceeds under this chapter, less expenses of the transfer or disposition as provided in
transfer of excess real property to a Federal agency for agency use; or

header.#text: Proceeds from transfer or sale of personal property

text.#text: Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, proceeds described in paragraph (2) shall be deposited in the Treasury as miscellaneous receipts.
The proceeds described in this paragraph are proceeds under this chapter from—
a transfer of excess personal property to a Federal agency for agency use; or
a sale, lease, or other disposition of surplus personal property.

Subject to regulations under this subtitle, the expenses of the sale of personal property may be paid from the proceeds of sale so that only the net proceeds are deposited in the Treasury. This paragraph applies whether proceeds are deposited as miscellaneous receipts or to the credit of an appropriation as authorized by law.

header.#text: Payment of expenses of sale before deposit

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

shall publish a single, comprehensive, and descriptive database of all Federal real property under the custody and control of all executive agencies, other than Federal real property excluded for reasons of national security, in accordance with subsection (b).

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall collect from the head of each executive agency descriptive information, except for classified information, of the nature, use, and extent of the Federal real property of each such agency, including the following:

text.#text: The
The geographic location of each Federal real property of each such agency, including the address and description for each such property.
The total size of each Federal real property of each such agency, including square footage and acreage of each such property.
The relevance of each Federal real property to the agency’s mission.
The level of use of each Federal real property for each such agency, including whether such property is excess, surplus, underutilized, or unutilized.
The number of days each Federal real property is designated as excess, surplus, underutilized, or unutilized.
The annual operating costs of each Federal real property.
The replacement value of each Federal real property.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, in consultation with the
, make the database established and maintained under this section available to other Federal agencies.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

text.#text: The
To the extent consistent with national security, the database shall be accessible by the public at no cost through the Web site of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure that the database—

text.#text: To the extent practicable, the
uses an open, machine-readable format;
permits users to search and sort Federal real property data; and
includes a means to download a large amount of Federal real property data and a selection of such data retrieved using a search.
Nothing in this section may be construed to require an agency to make available to the public information that is exempt from disclosure pursuant to
